greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of compositions of n using exactly k primes (counted with multiplicity); triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=floor(n/2), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; local j; if n=0 then 1
else []; for j to n do zip((x, y)->x+y, %,
mathematica: zip[f_, x_List, y_List, z_] :=  With[{m = Max[Length[x], Length[y]]},  Thread[f[PadRight[x, m, z], PadRight[y, m, z]]]]; T[n_] := T[n] =  Module[{j, pc}, If[n == 0, {1}, pc = {}; For[j = 1, j <= n, j++, pc = zip[Plus, pc, Join[If[PrimeQ[j], {0}, {}], T[n-j]], 0]]; pc]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 16}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 29 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 23 2013
